title: The Singular 'They': Grammar Wars
description: A quick win: understand The Singular 'They': Grammar Wars.

hook.text: Using 'they' for one person sparks heated debates today. But singular 'they' has been used since the 1300s.

buildup.text: Chaucer, Shakespeare, and Jane Austen all used 'they' to refer to a single person of unknown gender.

discovery.text: Prescriptive grammarians banned it in the 18th century and insisted on 'he' as the generic pronoun.

twist.text: The 'rule' that 'they' must be plural was invented â€” it was never how English naturally worked.

punchline.text: English speakers fought over 'they' for centuries. English itself already had the answer.
